info.name: Panlhuri Backend New API
info.description:
# Panthar Learning Management System - Complete API Documentation

## üìã Overview

This collection contains **ALL 143 endpoints** in the Panthar LMS backend with complete documentation, examples, and automated scripts.

**Base URL:** `http://localhost:8080`  
**Last Updated:** January 2026

---

## üöÄ Quick Start

1. Import this collection into Postman
    
2. Set `{{baseUrl}}` = `http://localhost:8080`
    
3. Run "Tester Login (Admin)" to get admin token
    
4. Browse endpoints by category
    
5. Check Examples tab for sample responses
    

---

## üìÅ Collection Structure

1. **Health Check** - Server status
    
2. **Authentication** - Login, logout, tokens
    
3. **Users & Trainers** - Profile management
    
4. **Categories** - Hierarchical categories
    
5. **Courses** - Course management
    
6. **Modules** - Module organization
    
7. **Lessons** - Lesson content, descriptions, attachments
    
8. **Progress Tracking** - Completion tracking, analytics
    
9. **Reviews & Ratings** - Course reviews
    
10. **Videos** - Video upload, streaming
    
11. **Plans & Subscriptions** - Subscription management
    
12. **Purchases & Entitlements** - Payment, access control
    
13. **Certificates** - Certificate generation
    
14. **Streaks & Leaderboards** - Daily streaks
    
15. **Webhooks** - Payment webhooks
    
16. **Video Streaming** - Video streaming
    

---

## üîê Authentication

All authenticated endpoints require: `Authorization: Bearer {{authToken}}`

Login endpoints auto-save `{{authToken}}` and `{{userId}}`

---

## üìä Response Format

### Success

``` json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Operation successful",
  "data": { /* response data */ }
}

 ```

### Error

``` json
{
  "success": false,
  "error": "Error type",
  "message": "Human-readable error message"
}

 ```

---

## üéØ HTTP Status Codes

- `200` - Success
    
- `201` - Created
    
- `400` - Bad Request
    
- `401` - Unauthorized
    
- `403` - Forbidden
    
- `404` - Not Found
    
- `409` - Conflict
    
- `500` - Server Error
    

---

**Happy Testing! üéâ**

request.description: Update FCM token for the current session. Use this when the device FCM token refreshes or changes. The old token is automatically replaced in the session - no manual cleanup needed. Max 2 active sessions per user are enforced automatically.

request.description: Logout from current session. Deletes the current session and automatically removes the associated FCM token. User remains logged in on other devices.

response.name: Logout Current Session - Success

request.description: Logout from all sessions (all devices). Deletes all user sessions and automatically removes all associated FCM tokens. Use this for 'Sign out everywhere' functionality.

response.name: Logout All Sessions - Success

request.description: Get paginated reviews for a course. Optional authentication - if authenticated, user's own review is separated and returned first. Returns reviews with user details, rating, review text, and timestamps.

response.name: Get Course Reviews

request.description: Get review statistics for a course (public endpoint). Returns: averageRating, totalReviews, and ratingDistribution (1-5 star breakdown with counts and percentages).

response.name: Get Course Review Stats

request.description: Create a new review or update existing review (upsert). One review per user per course. Rating is required (1-5 integer). Review text is optional (max 1000 characters). Automatically recalculates course averageRating and totalReviews.

response.name: Create or Update Review

request.description: Update your existing review. Must have already created a review. Rating is optional (keeps existing if not provided). Review text is optional. Automatically recalculates course rating cache.

response.name: Update Review

request.description: Delete your own review for a course. Automatically recalculates course averageRating and totalReviews. Cannot delete other users' reviews (use admin endpoint).

response.name: Delete Review

request.description: Admin-only endpoint to delete any review by reviewId. Use this for moderation purposes (spam, inappropriate content, etc.). Automatically recalculates course rating cache.
Create a new module (Admin/Trainer)
Update module (Admin/Trainer)
Delete module (Admin/Trainer). Cannot delete if module has lessons.
Update multiple module sequences at once
Update module status (draft/published/archived). Set updateLessons=true to also update all lessons in the module.
Recalculate and update module duration from its lessons
Get all modules for a course with lessons
Get module by ID with lessons and navigation
Get module by slug within a course

body.raw:
{
    "textContent": "# Welcome to the Yoga Fundamentals Course

This comprehensive lesson will guide you through the essential principles of yoga practice, perfect for beginners and those looking to deepen their understanding.

## What You'll Learn

- **Foundation Poses**: Master basic asanas including Mountain Pose, Downward Dog, and Child's Pose
- **Breathing Techniques**: Learn Ujjayi breath and its calming benefits
- **Alignment Principles**: Understand proper body mechanics to prevent injury
- **Mindfulness Practice**: Connect breath with movement

## Course Materials

Please refer to the attached PDF guide and reference chart in the attachments section below.

## Prerequisites

No prior yoga experience required! All you need is:
- Comfortable clothing
- A yoga mat or soft surface
- An open mind and willingness to learn

## Useful Resources

- [Yoga Alliance - Beginner's Guide](https://www.yogaalliance.org/learn)
- [Scientific Benefits of Yoga](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3193654/)
- [Recommended Props Guide](https://www.yogajournal.com/yoga-101/props/)

## Practice Schedule

For best results, practice this sequence 3-4 times per week, allowing at least one rest day between sessions.

---

_Remember: Yoga is a personal journey. Listen to your body and move at your own pace._

üí° **Pro Tip**: Keep a yoga journal to track your progress and insights!"

body.raw:
{
    "courseId": "{{courseId}}",
    "moduleId": null,
    "textContent": "# Yoga Philosophy

Yoga is an ancient practice that combines physical postures, breathing exercises, and meditation to promote physical, mental, and spiritual well-being.

## The Eight Limbs of Yoga

1. **Yama** (Moral disciplines) - Non-violence, truthfulness, non-stealing, celibacy, non-possessiveness
2. **Niyama** (Positive duties) - Cleanliness, contentment, austerity, self-study, surrender
3. **Asana** (Postures) - Physical poses to prepare body for meditation
4. **Pranayama** (Breath control) - Breathing exercises to control life force
5. **Pratyahara** (Withdrawal of senses) - Directing attention inward
6. **Dharana** (Concentration) - Single-pointed focus
7. **Dhyana** (Meditation) - Uninterrupted flow of concentration
8. **Samadhi** (Enlightenment) - State of bliss and union

## Benefits of Regular Practice

- Improved flexibility and strength
- Better posture and balance
- Reduced stress and anxiety
- Enhanced mental clarity
- Better sleep quality

> _"Yoga is the journey of the self, through the self, to the self."_ - Bhagavad Gita",
    "title": "Understanding Yoga Philosophy",
    "slug": "understanding-yoga-philosophy",
    "description": "A comprehensive guide to the philosophical foundations of yoga, including the Eight Limbs and core principles",
    "sequence": 2,
    "estimatedReadTime": 10,

        "topics": ["philosophy", "eight limbs", "meditation", "principles"]
    }
}

            "lessonId": "cmkgiluf00016riitmjhcbn3z",
            "content": "# Understanding Your Body in Yoga\n\n## Body Awareness is Key\n\nOne of the most important aspects of yoga is developing awareness of your body. This means:\n\n### Listen to Your Body\n- Every body is different and unique\n- What feels good for others might not work for you\n- Pain is never the goal in yoga\n- Discomfort vs pain: learn the difference\n\n### Breathing and Movement\n- Your breath guides your practice\n- Move with your breath, not against it\n- If you can't breathe comfortably, ease up\n- Breath is your best teacher\n\n### Modifications Are Your Friend\n- Every pose can be modified\n- Props can help you find comfort\n- There's no \"perfect\" pose\n- Progress is personal\n\n## Building Your Foundation\n\n### Start Slow\nBegin with basic poses and simple movements. Build strength and flexibility gradually.\n\n### Consistency Over Intensity\nA short daily practice is better than an intense weekly session.\n\n### Be Patient\nFlexibility and strength take time to develop. Enjoy the journey!\n\nRemember: Yoga is not about perfection‚Äîit's about connection with yourself.",

request.description:
### Create or Replace Subscription Plan (Admin Only)

This endpoint is used for both initial creation and **Pricing Changes**.

#### üîÑ Pricing Change Flow
To change a price, you must create a NEW plan record. 
1. Pass `"deactivateOthers": true` in the body.
2. The system will automatically mark the current active plan for this content as `isActive: false`.
3. The new plan will be created and become the default for new sales.

#### üìÇ Plan Types
- `COURSE`: Must use `subscriptionType: "lifetime"` (One-time payment).
- `CATEGORY`: Access to a specific category and its children.
- `WHOLE_APP`: Access to everything in the platform.

#### ‚öñÔ∏è Constraints
- **Courses** only support `lifetime`. Recurring trials are NOT supported for individual courses.
- **Uniqueness**: Only one active plan per `SubscriptionType` and `Target` is allowed. Use `deactivateOthers` to swap them.
- **Trial Support**: Only for CATEGORY and WHOLE_APP plans.

request.description:
### Update Plan Metadata (Admin Only)

Updates an existing plan's display information or status. Uses a strict **Whitelist** approach.

**‚úÖ Allowed Fields:**
- `name`, `slug`, `description`, `duration`, `features`, `isActive`, `order` 

**üö´ Immutable Fields:**
- `price`, `discountedPrice`, `currency`, `subscriptionType`, `planType`, `targetId`, `provider`, `planId`, `trialFee`, `trialDays` 

**Note:** To change any immutable billing or structure field, you MUST create a NEW plan using the `POST /api/plans` endpoint with `deactivateOthers: true`.

### Deactivate Plan (Admin Only)

This endpoint performs a **Soft Delete** by marking the plan as `isActive: false`.

**üö® Rules:**
- **No Active Subscriptions**: You can only delete/deactivate a plan if NO users are currently subscribed to it (trial/active/past_due).
- **Stop Selling**: Once a plan is deactivated, it will no longer appear in the public store, but past records are preserved in the database for auditing.

request.description: Get a specific plan by its slug (public endpoint)
Get a specific plan by ID (requires login)

### Initiate Access Purchase/Subscription

This single endpoint handles both **Course Lifetime Purchases** and **Category/App Subscriptions**.

#### üõ°Ô∏è Protection Logic (Hierarchy)
- **Full App Access**: If the user has a WHOLE_APP entitlement, any further subscription attempt is blocked.
- **Parent Access**: If the user owns a Parent Category, they are blocked from buying any Child Categories or Courses within that tree.
- **Duplicate Check**: Prevents buying the same course or category twice.

#### ‚è±Ô∏è Trial Flow
- **Rule**: Max ONE trial per user across the whole platform.
- **Tracking**: The system checks the `hasUsedTrial` flag on the user profile.
- **Support**: Trials are supported for CATEGORY and WHOLE_APP. Courses do NOT have trials.

#### üí≥ Payment Flow
1. **Course (Lifetime)**: Returns a Razorpay `orderId`. High-speed, one-time payment.
2. **Category/App (Recurring)**: Returns a Razorpay `subscriptionId` and `shortUrl`. Handles recurring cycles and trials automatically.

```json
}
```

**Response Codes:**
- `200` - Webhook processed
- `400` - Invalid signature
- `500` - Processing error

**No authentication required** (verified via signature)
**Platform:** Google Play, App Store
**Use case:** Subscription renewal notifications
